title: Job Openings at Duob Recruitment
content:
Duob Recruitment, a recruitment firm, is recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head of Commercial (Growth & Partnerships) | FMCG Sector

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and commercially astute leader to join our team as Head of Commercial (Growth & Partnerships).
	This strategic role will drive revenue growth, expand market share, and forge high-value partnerships within the FMCG sector.
	The ideal candidate is a results-driven professional with a deep understanding of the FMCG landscape, proven experience in building growth strategies, and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver on sales, distribution, and profitability objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Commercial Strategy & Growth:


	Develop and implement robust commercial strategies to achieve revenue, profitability, and market share targets.
	Identify and execute new market opportunities, product innovations, and go-to-market models.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and consumer insights.


Partnerships & Business Development:


	Build and manage strategic partnerships with distributors, retailers, and external stakeholders.
	Negotiate and manage high-value contracts, alliances, and joint ventures.
	Drive collaboration with e-commerce, modern trade, and traditional trade channels.


Sales & Distribution Excellence:


	Oversee national and regional sales operations for strong execution.
	Optimize pricing, promotions, and channel strategies.
	Lead key account management and strengthen customer relationships.


Leadership & Team Development:


	Lead and mentor a high-performing commercial team.
	Foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and customer focus.
	Collaborate across marketing, supply chain, finance, and production.


Performance Management & Reporting:


	Set and track KPIs for growth, sales, and partnerships.
	Provide regular insights and reports to executive leadership.
	Ensure compliance with policies, regulations, and ethical standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field (MBA preferred).
	10+ years of progressive commercial leadership experience in FMCG, including 6+ years at senior management level.
	Proven track record of driving revenue growth, partnerships, and business results.
	Strong knowledge of FMCG value chain, distribution, and retail networks.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to lead and inspire high-performing teams.
	Strong analytical, strategic, and financial acumen.


Key Competencies:


	Commercial & Financial Acumen.
	Strategic Leadership.
	Negotiation & Influencing.
	Market Development & Expansion.
	Relationship & Stakeholder Management.
	Results Orientation.


Benefits


	Opportunity to lead growth in a dynamic FMCG company.
	Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives.
	Collaborative and innovative work environment.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.


Application Closing Date: 10th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@recruitng.com using "Head of Commercial" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Executive Assistant to the CEO & Business Director

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We areseeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide strategic and operational support to the CEO and Business Director.
	This role goes beyond traditional administrative duties—acting as a trusted partner who ensures the smooth execution of priorities, effective stakeholder engagement, and alignment of internal operations with leadership’s vision.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and thrives in fast-paced environments while maintaining confidentiality and professionalism.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Support:


	Manage and optimize the CEO’s and Business Director’s calendars, travel, meetings, and correspondence.
	Prioritize and filter communication to ensure leadership’s time is spent on high-value activities.
	Handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.


Project & Operational Coordination:


	Track and follow up on action items across departments to ensure execution of leadership priorities.
	Support preparation and coordination of internal strategy sessions, performance reviews, and cross-functional projects.
	Assist in aligning internal operations with the company’s strategic direction.


Stakeholder & Relationship Management:


	Serve as a liaison between leadership and external stakeholders including investors, partners, donors, and government officials.
	Draft and review correspondence, proposals, and reports to ensure clarity and professionalism.


Research & Strategic Briefings:


	Conduct research and prepare briefing materials, talking points, and presentations for meetings and external engagements.
	Ensure the CEO and Business Director are fully prepared for all internal and external commitments.


Execution & Accountability:


	Anticipate needs and proactively resolve issues before they escalate.
	Monitor deadlines, decisions, and follow-ups, ensuring momentum is maintained across initiatives.
	Provide clear reporting and updates to keep leadership informed.


Ideal Candidate Profile


	4–7 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff, or in a senior operations role (experience in high-growth or international organizations is an advantage).
	Excellent organizational, communication, and writing skills.
	High emotional intelligence and the ability to build trust across diverse stakeholders.
	Strong judgment, discretion, and ability to handle sensitive matters.
	Comfortable managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
	Tech-savvy and resourceful, with proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and virtual collaboration tools.
	Entrepreneurial mindset with a proactive, solution-oriented approach.


What Success Looks Like:


	The CEO and Business Director operate with maximum efficiency and minimal blockers.
	Internal projects and communications are well-coordinated and executed on time.
	Stakeholder engagements are timely, strategic, and professional.
	Leadership decisions are supported with well-prepared briefs and follow-through.
	Critical issues are identified early and managed effectively.


Salary
N400,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@duobrecruitment.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Fleet Manager (Heavy Duty Vehicles)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Oil and Gas

Summary


	Our organization is seeking an experienced Fleet Manager to oversee and ensure the effective management of our fleet of heavy-duty vehicles.
	This role requires a results-oriented professional with proven expertise in managing large-scale fleet operations in Nigeria, ensuring maximum vehicle uptime, strict cost control, driver discipline, and compliance with statutory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operations of heavy-duty vehicles, ensuring timely deployment and availability.
	Implement preventive and corrective maintenance programs to guarantee roadworthiness.
	Ensure strict compliance with FRSC, VIO, and other regulatory requirements.
	Control fuel usage, maintenance costs, and spare parts inventory.
	Set performance standards for drivers and mechanics, enforcing discipline and safety.
	Investigate accidents, breakdowns, and incidents with proper documentation.
	Negotiate/manage contracts with service providers, workshops, and suppliers.
	Develop and maintain fleet tracking/monitoring systems.
	Recruit, train, and supervise fleet staff to drive a performance-based culture.
	Manage fleet budgets, ensuring cost-effectiveness and efficiency.
	Provide management with accurate fleet performance and utilization reports.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Transport Management, Mechanical/Automobile Engineering, or related field.
	10 - 15 years of proven experience managing heavy-duty fleets in Nigeria (logistics, haulage, manufacturing, or FMCG).
	Professional certifications (CILT or equivalent).
	Strong technical knowledge of heavy-duty vehicles, maintenance, and spare parts.
	Solid experience working with drivers, unions, workshops, and regulatory agencies.
	Demonstrated ability to reduce costs, improve efficiency, and enforce discipline.
	Proficiency in fleet management systems & Microsoft Office tools.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership & people management skills.
	Excellent negotiation & vendor management ability.
	High integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.
	Hands-on problem solver with resilience under pressure.
	Safety conscious & compliance driven.


Application Closing Date: 10th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: info@recruitng.com using "Fleet Manager" as the subject of the mail.

Assistant Executive Officer (Accounts) Job at Federal College of Education




        
    

        
        Federal College of Education, Iwo is a public institution in Osun State, Nigeria authorized with the issuance of National Certificate in Education (NCE) to successful graduating students. The College of Education, among the 30 new higher institutions established by the Muhammadu Buhari's administration since assuming power in 2015, was established in 2020.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates for the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Executive Officer (Accounts)

Job Location: Iwo, Osun

Requirements
     

            
    




	Candidate must possess a National Diploma in Business Studies or Accountancy from a recognized institution of higher learning.
	Candidates must be computer literate.
	Certificate of National Youth Service Corps (NYSC).
	Evidence of Proficiency in ICT.


Grade
CONPCASS 05.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit fifteen (15) copies of their application letters, detailed Curriculum Vitae (CV) and other supporting documents. The Curriculum Vitae (CV) should be presented in the following order:


	Full Names: (Sumame first and in capitals)
	Date of Birth
	Place of Birth
	Gender
	Nationality
	State of origin
	Local Government Area
	Details of Contact Address
	
		Residential Address
		Email Address
		Mobile Telephone Number(s) (inclusive of WhatsApp)
	
	
	Permanent Home Address
	Marital status
	Number and ages of children
	Name of Next of Kin
	Address of Next of Kin
	Educational Institutions attended with Dates
	Academic and Professional Qualifications with Dates
	Scholarships and Prizes
	Honours, Merits and Distinctions
	Work Experience with Dates
	Present Employer
	Status and Salary
	Extra-Curricular Activities
	Names and Addresses of Three (3) Referees.


Applications, in a sealed envelope with the desired post and department indicated on the top right side of the envelope, should be addressed and sent to:
The Registrar,
Federal College of Education,
P.M.B. 420,
Iwo, Osun State.

Note


	Applicants who are physically challenged should state the nature of their disabilities.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further communication.

Receptionist Job at Espritsor Enterprises




        
    

        
        Espritsor - Our client, a four star hotel and resort, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're looking for a professional and welcoming Receptionist to be the first point of contact for our visitors and clients.
	If you have a passion for providing excellent customer service and enjoy a fast-paced environment, this role is for you.


?Responsibilities
     

            
    




	?Greet and welcome guests warmly and professionally.
	?Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls.
	?Manage general inquiries and provide accurate information.
	?Handle administrative tasks like scheduling and mail sorting.
	?Maintain a tidy and presentable reception area.


?Requirements


	?Proven experience as a Receptionist or in a similar role.
	?Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	?Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	?Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	?A friendly, polite, and professional demeanor.
	Must reside in or close to Ajah.


Salary
N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: Timelessbeachresortng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Apply now and become the welcoming face of our company!
